User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/535.1 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/14.0.835.202 Safari/535.1

Steps to reproduce:


- drag and drop test-ff7-win.xpi into FF7 on WINDOWS.
- at the end of installation, press restart button proposed by FF.


Actual results:


- drag and drop test.html
- you will get an alert saying 'exception on Version()'
- BUT, if you then close your browser manually, reopen and reload the test.html, then voila ... the Version() returns correctly.

note.
- right after that first restart, it seems the binary component of the ext is not loaded properly, hence when calling the Version(), it will fail.
- javascript component seems to be loaded properly after this first restart ( i.e. but the test.xpi does NOT contain this ).
- this behavior is the same on OSX and Linux version as well.
- this behavior only exist since FF7 ( i.e. tried on FF8 too ), exactly the same code base has always been OK since FF3 - FF6.



Expected results:


- you should get alert saying '01000000' right after that first restart when test.html is loaded( i.e. '01000000' is actually the value returned by the Version method implemented inside the binary component ).
